column4: Hey guys, I'm trying to install a network printer on Ubuntu 11.04 --- I keep getting this error: "Tree connect failed (NT_STATUS_BAD_NETWORK_NAME)"
Use IP address.
I am
Can you ping it?
yes
Where are you getting the error from?
the web-interface, the printer application in ubuntu just says "Unable to connect to CIFS host"
I should also point out that the printer is hosted on a Windows 7 computer.
Then it is NOT a network printer.  It is a shared printer.
sorry it's what I considered a network printer.
Probably best to plug the printer directly into the Ubuntu machine.
I would if I could, but I guess I can find other work arounds.
Why can't you?
it's a family used printer and I don't have the room in my room to move it to
Does your router have a print server option?
no
Well, I don't know then.  I've never tried to access a printer shared from Win7
have you had success trying to access a printer from any SMB?
Yes
well I can connect to the printer via smb (the printing application can see it) I just cannot print to it.

I should clarify:  I have shared a printer connected to a Linux computer with a MS Windows computer.  That is the experience I have.  I do not have experience in accessing a printer shared from a MS Windows computer.
ok, thanks for your help anyway.
